weatherForecast.comment: Easter Monday starts predominantly sunny. In the afternoon cumulus clouds are forming and thunderstorms are to expect. Moderate westerly winds. Temperatures in 2.000 m are around +6 degrees.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Only little amount of snow, but spontaneous loose-snow avalanches from steep shady slopes are possible.
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Nevertheless danger spots are located ind very steep shady slopes. There small sized spontaneous loose-snow and wet-snow avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is isothermal and till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed sloped the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: Tuesday will be changeable and mild. No significant change of the avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.comment: Easter Monday starts predominantly sunny. In the afternoon cumulus clouds are forming and thunderstorms are to expect. Moderate westerly winds. Temperatures in 2.000 m are around +6 degrees.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Avalanche danger differs during the course of the day!  Increasing small spontaneous wet-snow avalanches from steep terrain in high altitude!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger increases from lowbrow moderate  above 1.800 m. Danger spots are located in steep shady slopes and gullies. There spontaneous loose-snow avalanches are possible. On smooth surfaces gliding-snow avalanches are still possible. Avoid areas below glide cracks. Avalanches are small to medium sized.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is isothermal and till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed sloped the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: Tuesday will be changeable and mild. No significant change of the avalanche danger.

customData.generalHeadline: Good mountain weather, in high altitudes still wet-snow problem.
